search_parameters.q: what is showrooming, and how has it affected offline retailers?

search_information.query_displayed: what is showrooming, and how has it affected offline retailers?

related_questions.question: What is showrooming in retail?
related_questions.snippet: Showrooming is the practice of visiting brick-and-mortar retail stores to research merchandise before purchasing it online for a lower price. This phenomenon became popular following the rise of e-commerce and mobile devices.
related_questions.title: Showrooming: What it Means, How it Works, Compared to Webrooming

related_questions.question: What are the pros and cons of showrooming?
related_questions.snippet: - Customer engagement: Showrooming can provide a valuable opportunity for retailers to engage with customers in person, answer questions, and provide a level of customer service that online retailers cannot. 2. Cons: - Loss of sales: The biggest concern for retailers with showrooming is the potential loss of sales.
related_questions.title: The Pros And Cons Of Showrooming - FasterCapital

related_questions.question: What is showrooming and the competition between store and online retailers?
related_questions.snippet: Customers often evaluate products at brick-and-mortar stores to identify their ‚Äúbest fit‚Äù product but buy it for a lower price at a competing online retailer. This free-riding behavior by customers is referred to as ‚Äúshowrooming‚Äù and we show that this is detrimental to the profits of the brick-and-mortar stores.
related_questions.title: 'Showrooming' and the Competition between Store and Online Retailers

related_questions.question: What are offline retailers?
related_questions.snippet: An offline retailer is a retailer that sell products through a storefront location in-person.
related_questions.title: Offline retailer | Bustyresources Wiki | Fandom
